caption: Table 3g - A07: Authentication Failures Coverage by AWS Security Agent*
note: * The evaluation was conducted against a sample simplified applications with known vulnerabilities. As a result, additional weaknesses or architectural limitations commonly observed in real-world, large-scale applications may not be represented. Analysis of such scenarios is outside the scope of this research.
rows: CWE-1390: Weak Authentication
Covered

Description: The service successfully detects weak authentication through dedicated authentication bypass testing that includes weak authentication validation. Evidence: Penetration test findings demonstrate weak authentication detection including user enumeration via verbose error messages. Authentication bypass action groups validate weak authentication scenarios.
CWE-1391: Use of Weak Credentials
Covered

Description: The service successfully detects weak credentials through dedicated cryptographic vulnerability testing and information disclosure testing. Evidence: Penetration test findings demonstrate weak credential detection including plaintext password storage and debug endpoints exposing sensitive credentials without authentication. Cryptographic vulnerability testing validates credential protection.
CWE-1392: Use of Default Credentials
Covered

Description: The service successfully detects use of default credentials through dedicated findings that identify default credential usage in deployed applications. Evidence: Penetration test findings demonstrate comprehensive default credential testing including testing of multiple default credential pairs and validation of administrative access granted through default credentials.
CWE-1393: Use of Default Password
Covered

Description: The service successfully detects use of default passwords through dedicated findings that identify default password usage in deployed applications. Evidence: Penetration test findings demonstrate comprehensive default password testing including successful authentication with default passwords that provide full administrative access.
CWE-258: Empty Password in Configuration File
Partial

Description: The service includes static analysis through code scanner which may detect empty passwords in configuration files, but explicit systematic validation of empty password detection is not comprehensively performed. Evidence: Code scanner capabilities may detect empty passwords in configuration files through static analysis but do not show comprehensive validation of empty password detection. Limitations: Explicit systematic validation of empty password detection in configuration files is not comprehensively performed [UL-008].
CWE-259: Use of Hard-coded Password
Covered

Description: The service detects use of hard-coded passwords through findings that identify plaintext password storage in the application. Evidence: Code scanner findings demonstrate detection of plaintext password storage in database models and authentication logic across multiple applications.
CWE-287: Improper Authentication
Covered

Description: The service successfully detects improper authentication through findings that demonstrate authentication bypass vulnerabilities. Evidence: Penetration test findings demonstrate comprehensive authentication testing capabilities including SQL injection-based authentication bypass detection.
CWE-288: Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel
Covered

Description: The service detects authentication bypass through alternate paths or channels via findings that demonstrate unauthorized access through non-standard authentication vectors. Evidence: Authentication bypass findings demonstrate detection of authentication bypass using SQL injection as an alternate path to bypass normal authentication controls.
CWE-289: Authentication Bypass by Alternate Name
Partial

Description: The service performs comprehensive authentication bypass testing which may detect alternate name bypass techniques indirectly, but explicit systematic validation of authentication bypass by alternate name is not comprehensively performed. Evidence: Authentication bypass testing action groups test various authentication bypass techniques but do not explicitly test for alternate name bypass. Limitations: Explicit systematic validation of authentication bypass by alternate name is not comprehensively performed [UL-007].
CWE-290: Authentication Bypass by Spoofing
Covered

Description: The service successfully detects authentication bypass by spoofing through dedicated authentication bypass testing that includes header spoofing validation. Evidence: Penetration test findings demonstrate spoofing-based authentication bypass detection through header manipulation. Authentication bypass action groups test for trusted client header spoofing.
CWE-291: Reliance on IP Address for Authentication
Covered

Description: The service tests for reliance on IP address for authentication through authentication bypass testing action groups that include testing for IP address-based client authentication mechanisms. Evidence: Authentication bypass action groups test for IP address-based client authentication bypass attempts as part of comprehensive authentication testing.
CWE-293: Using Referer Field for Authentication
Covered

Description: The service tests for use of Referer field for authentication through authentication bypass testing action groups that include testing for Referer header-based authentication mechanisms. Evidence: Authentication bypass action groups test for Referer field authentication bypass attempts through Referer header manipulation and validation testing.
CWE-294: Authentication Bypass by Capture-replay
Partial

Description: The service performs session management testing which includes capture-replay testing of session tokens, but explicit systematic validation of authentication bypass by capture-replay of authentication tokens is not comprehensively performed. Evidence: Session management testing includes capture-replay testing of session tokens but does not explicitly test for authentication token replay. Limitations: Explicit systematic validation of authentication bypass by capture-replay of authentication tokens is not comprehensively performed [UL-007].
CWE-295: Improper Certificate Validation
Covered

Description: The service includes explicit certificate validation testing via TLS scanner that tests for improper certificate validation including self-signed certificates and certificate chain validation. Evidence: Network scanner action groups use TLS/SSL scanning tools that perform comprehensive certificate validation including certificate chain validation and trust store validation.
CWE-297: Improper Validation of Certificate with Host Mismatch
Covered

Description: The service tests for improper validation of certificate with host mismatch via TLS scanner that validates certificate Common Name and Subject Alternative Name fields against the server hostname. Evidence: TLS scanner validates that certificate Common Name and Subject Alternative Name fields match the server hostname and detects hostname mismatches.
CWE-298: Improper Validation of Certificate Expiration
Covered

Description: The service tests for improper validation of certificate expiration via TLS scanner that validates certificate expiration dates and provides warnings for expiring certificates. Evidence: TLS scanner checks certificate expiration dates and provides warnings for certificates nearing expiration as part of standard certificate validation.
CWE-299: Improper Check for Certificate Revocation
Covered

Description: The service tests for improper check for certificate revocation via TLS scanner that validates certificate revocation status using both CRL and OCSP methods. Evidence: TLS scanner checks certificate revocation status using Certificate Revocation List and Online Certificate Status Protocol validation.
CWE-300: Channel Accessible by Non-Endpoint
Not Covered

Description: The service does not include explicit testing for channel accessibility by non-endpoints. Evidence: Extended penetration testing confirmed Network scanner performs endpoint discovery but does not test for channels accessible by non-endpoints. This is a network architecture testing concern outside the web application penetration testing scope. Limitations: Channel accessibility testing by non-endpoints is not systematically performed [UL-007].
CWE-302: Authentication Bypass by Assumed-Immutable Data
Partial

Description: The service performs comprehensive authentication bypass testing, privilege escalation testing, and IDOR testing which may detect assumed-immutable data tampering indirectly, but explicit systematic validation of authentication bypass by assumed-immutable data tampering is not comprehensively performed. Evidence: Authentication bypass, privilege escalation, and IDOR testing may detect assumed-immutable data tampering but do not explicitly test for authentication bypass by assumed-immutable data. Limitations: Explicit systematic validation of authentication bypass by assumed-immutable data tampering is not comprehensively performed [UL-007].
CWE-303: Incorrect Implementation of Authentication Algorithm
Covered

Description: The service detects incorrect implementation of authentication algorithms through design review analysis that identifies weak password hashing implementations and weak secret usage. Evidence: Design review findings demonstrate detection of weak password hashing implementations including MD5 without salt and weak JWT secret usage.
CWE-304: Missing Critical Step in Authentication
Partial

Description: The service may detect missing critical authentication steps indirectly through authentication bypass findings, but explicit validation of authentication flow completeness is not systematically performed. Evidence: Authentication bypass findings may indicate missing critical authentication steps but do not explicitly test for missing critical steps in authentication. Limitations: Explicit validation of authentication flow completeness is not systematically performed [UL-007].
CWE-305: Authentication Bypass by Primary Weakness
Covered

Description: The service detects authentication bypass through primary weaknesses in authentication mechanisms, as demonstrated by SQL injection-based authentication bypass findings. Evidence: Authentication bypass findings demonstrate authentication bypass through a primary weakness in the authentication mechanism.
CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
Covered

Description: The service successfully detects missing authentication for critical functions through dedicated findings that identify unauthenticated access to administrative interfaces and critical application functions. Evidence: Penetration test findings demonstrate comprehensive testing capabilities for missing authentication vulnerabilities including unauthenticated access to administrative functions and file management systems.
CWE-307: Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts
Covered

Description: The service successfully detects improper restriction of excessive authentication attempts through dedicated testing of authentication endpoints. Evidence: Penetration test findings demonstrate comprehensive rate limiting testing including multiple failed login attempts, response header analysis, and account lockout testing.
CWE-308: Use of Single-factor Authentication
Not Covered

Description: The service does not test for or identify single-factor authentication usage. Evidence: Extended penetration testing confirmed no MFA testing, single-factor authentication identification, or authentication factor count validation was performed. Single-factor authentication is an authentication design decision, not a testable vulnerability. Limitations: Single-factor authentication testing is not part of the testing scope [UL-007].
CWE-309: Use of Password System for Primary Authentication
Partial

Description: The service may identify password-based authentication systems through design review and runtime testing, but explicit evaluation of the appropriateness of using password systems for primary authentication is not systematically performed. Evidence: Design review and runtime testing identify password-based authentication systems but do not explicitly evaluate whether password systems are appropriate for primary authentication. Limitations: Explicit evaluation of the appropriateness of using password systems for primary authentication is not systematically performed [UL-007].
CWE-346: Origin Validation Error
Covered

Description: The service tests for origin validation errors through authentication bypass testing action groups that include testing for Origin header validation logic. Evidence: Authentication bypass action groups test for origin validation logic bypass attempts through Origin header validation and bypass testing.
CWE-350: Reliance on Reverse DNS Resolution for a Security-Critical Action
Not Covered

Description: The service does not include explicit testing for reliance on reverse DNS resolution for security-critical actions. Evidence: Extended penetration testing confirmed Network scanner and Code scanner do not test for reverse DNS resolution reliance. This is a network configuration testing concern outside the web application penetration testing scope. Limitations: Reverse DNS resolution reliance testing is not systematically performed [UL-007].
CWE-384: Session Fixation
Covered

Description: The service successfully detects session fixation vulnerabilities through findings that identify lack of session regeneration on authentication. Evidence: Session management findings demonstrate detection of session fixation vulnerabilities where session identifiers are not regenerated after successful authentication.
CWE-521: Weak Password Requirements
Not Covered

Description: The service does not include explicit runtime testing for weak password requirements. Evidence: Extended penetration testing confirmed no password policy testing was performed. Design review may identify lack of password complexity requirements but explicit runtime testing for weak password requirements is policy testing, not penetration testing. Limitations: Password requirement policy testing is not systematically performed [UL-007].
CWE-613: Insufficient Session Expiration
Covered

Description: The service tests for insufficient session expiration through session management testing that validates session lifecycle and expiration mechanisms. Evidence: Session management testing demonstrates detection of insufficient session expiration including detection of non-expiring tokens and session security configuration issues.
CWE-620: Unverified Password Change
Not Tested

Description: This vulnerability requires password change functionality in the application. Evidence: Analysis of tested applications confirmed none of them implement password change functionality, making this vulnerability not applicable. Limitations:
CWE-640: Weak Password Recovery Mechanism for Forgotten Password
Not Tested

Description: This vulnerability requires password recovery functionality in the application. Evidence: Analysis of tested applications confirmed none of them implement password recovery functionality, making this vulnerability not applicable. Limitations:
CWE-798: Use of Hard-coded Credentials
Covered

Description: The service detects use of hard-coded credentials through findings that identify plaintext credential storage. Evidence: Code scanner findings demonstrate detection of hard-coded credentials including plaintext credential storage in database models and authentication logic.
CWE-940: Improper Verification of Source of a Communication Channel
Not Covered

Description: The service does not include explicit testing for improper verification of communication channel source. Evidence: Extended penetration testing confirmed Network scanner and Session token vulnerabilities testing do not test for communication channel source verification. This is a network security testing concern outside the web application penetration testing scope. Limitations: Communication channel source verification testing is not systematically performed [UL-007].
CWE-941: Incorrectly Specified Destination in a Communication Channel
Not Covered

Description: The service does not include explicit testing for incorrectly specified destinations in communication channels. Evidence: Extended penetration testing confirmed Network scanner and SSRF testing do not test for communication channel destination verification. This is a network security testing concern outside the web application penetration testing scope. Limitations: Communication channel destination verification testing is not systematically performed [UL-007].
